content.description:
Sit start matched on the arete. From there, follow the arete up a short distance, commit to the slab, and cruise the easy finish.

It's tempting to follow the arete for its entirety, but the rock quality on the top section is seriously questionable.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's northwest arete.

content.description:
Sit start with a pair of edges. From there, follow the feature as it trends right using edges and bumps, make a big move to the shelf, and continue upward through the stepped finale.

I cleaned a lot of loose rock from the top of this route, and there is a considerable amount of sand/soil remaining. It's clean now, but anyone visiting after a rain will have to do some cleaning.
content.protection: At least three pads, four ideally. The immediate landing is great, but the ending climbs over an adjacent boulder.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's southwest face.

content.description: Sit start with opposing sidepulls. From there, climb straight up through sidepulls, eventually gain the shelf, and finish up the remaining slab.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good but slightly sloping.
content.location: It climbs the boulder's east face.
